dlgLine.text: You need to just turn around - there's nothing for you here. The camp is ours and we'll kill for it if we have to.

dlgAnsw.text: Whoa... hold on. We didn't know there was anyone here.
You sure you want to be aiming weapons at me? You killed anyone before?
Do you have anything worth dying for? Ask yourself that.
I didn't know anyone was here - but now that I do, maybe we can help each other out.
Calm down... Let's talk - what's your name?

dlgLine.text: Well, now you know. Turn right the fuck around and go about your business. Go on.

dlgAnsw.text: Listen, I'm from a shelter, not far from here. We're always looking for more people.
Don't threaten me... It makes people regret my actions.
I didn't know anyone was here - but now that I do, maybe we can help each other out.
Calm down... Let's talk - what's your name?
Okay, I'm leaving - don't shoot.

dlgLine.text: Sure have... And that's why I'm giving you a choice.

dlgAnsw.text: Listen, I'm from a shelter, not far from here. We're always looking for more people.
I don't know. I like it here. Maybe I'll sign up for some activities - you guys got archery?
I didn't know anyone was here - but now that I do, maybe we can help each other out.
Calm down... Let's talk - what's your name?
Okay, I'm leaving - don't shoot.

dlgLine.text: We wouldn't be here if there wasn't. But you better believe, we want it more than you do. Now... get on your way and don't come back.

dlgAnsw.text: You don't know who you're dealing with, pal...
Wait... we obviously got off on the wrong foot. I have a shelter, a place for all of you.
Here's my offer to anyone listening - you can die today or you can take your chances elsewhere. This is as fair as I get.
Okay, I'm leaving - don't shoot.

dlgLine.text: Don't need anything... I figured everything out. This group, current supplies, our location - we're set until this whole thing blows over. But keep talking, who knows...

dlgAnsw.text: Honestly - we've got food, water, running electricity, plumbing... You'd be better off with us. There's safety in numbers.
Maybe we could trade info - have you heard anything about what's going on outside this area?
I'm a competent medic - if you've got any sick or injured, I could take a look.
There's got to be something here collecting dust. I've got a few things myself.
I can teach your people how to make simple explosives.
You're all set, huh? Must mean you've stockpiled quite a bounty...
I guess we'll leave you in peace, then. Good luck to you.

dlgLine.text: Hey - stay where you are. I don't want anyone here catching anything. Had one guy come down with a fever a few weeks ago and it damn near killed him.

And to address the issue - we're fine right here. We've got everything we need - food, water, shelter, weapons. Don't see many of those dead people this far out either. No... we're not going anywhere.

dlgAnsw.text: We've got to band together and pool resources if we want to get through this. There are worse things out there than the dead.
Well, if that's your final decision, I guess I'll be going. Good luck to you.
Maybe we can work out a trade. That's not too much to ask, right?
I'm just happy to see another survivor. What's your name?
I can't come back empty-handed. Why don't you give us something for our trouble and we'll be on our way.

dlgLine.text: What, really? It's, uh... Ben. But if you think that's going to get me to put down my weapon, you'd be wrong. You're not the first people who made the trip out here, but I'd like it very much if we didn't have a repeat of last time.

dlgAnsw.text: What happened?
It's just going to get worse... You should come back with us, join our group. Safety in numbers and all.
How about a quick trade? Then we'll be on our way.
Sounds like you've had trouble in the past. Tell you what - give me something useful and I won't cause any further problems for you folks.

dlgLine.text: What? ...Look, the only reason we didn't shoot you is because you're alive. If you want to stay that way, you better start moving in the opposite direction. Now.
They're survivors just like us. Leave them be - let's go.
I don't like this guy's tone. Say the word and I'll shove that gun straight up his ass.
You going to take that from this piece of shit?
C'mon, let's go. Leave 'em be.
<Whisper to you>I want to kill this guy...
I don't want to hurt these people - why don't we just go?

dlgAnsw.text: Sorry, I'm just a little on edge, maybe we can trade? Make this right?
If you don't want a fight, I suggest you give me something I can use.
You should have shot when you had the chance - you're all dead, you hear me?!
I took down the Coyotes - what do you think that means I'll do to you?!
Here's my offer to anyone listening - you can die today or you can take your chances elsewhere. This is as fair as I get.
Okay, I'm leaving - don't shoot.

dlgLine.text: Huh... Depends on what you know. Not like we hear much about the world out here.

dlgAnsw.text: Here's something - Antibiotics will keep the infection at bay, if you get bit.
Those shelters they sent people to... doesn't seem like it worked out.
As far as I can tell, most towns and cities belong to the dead.
<Lie>What, you didn't hear? The military has taken back Austin. We're headed there ourselves.

dlgLine.text: Hmm... Okay, stay there. One of our guys has a rash that won't seem to go away. If you could take a look, maybe figure out what it is, then I might be able to give you something.

dlgAnsw.text: Sure.

dlgLine.text: So, what's your diagnosis?

dlgAnsw.text: It's poison oak. Wash the area off and soak in water if you can. And... use toilet paper or some other kind of leaf.

dlgLine.text: We could definitely use that... especially if anyone tries to attack us again.

dlgAnsw.text: Okay - here's what you're going to need... <You being walking him through it.>

dlgLine.text: I caught some of that... But I wrote it down just in case. That's pretty clever, I have to say.

dlgAnsw.text: Glad I could help.
Just don't use it on us, please.
Please be really careful. It could really... blow someone up.

dlgLine.text: Oh, that's a relief. I was worried Bill had some some kind of flesh-eating bacteria or that walking death. We owe you something...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: You just keep moving... And don't ever let me catch you around here again.

dlgAnsw.text: We're going.
I'll leave, but it's going to cost you. Give me something I like, I'll leave you alone.
I don't like threats. <Attack him>

dlgLine.text: Like I said - things are working for us right here. We'll take our chances at the camp, thanks.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm going. Good luck to all of you.
Suit yourself.
How about a quick trade? Then we'll be on our way.

dlgLine.text: <Looks to the others>Well, go on! You want to get us all killed? Get going!

dlgAnsw.text: Take the clothes on your back and go - anyone tries anything and I'll kill you all.
Just walk away.
Damn... I really wanted someone to resist.
I can't risk you coming back at me. No one leaves here alive.

dlgLine.text: You all are eating the living just like those dead people out there...
You're going to get what's coming to you one of these days... You hear me?

dlgAnsw.text: <The members of the camp leave as quickly as they can.>

dlgLine.text: We've got a few bows we're not using... Guess I could let them go. What've you got to trade?

dlgAnsw.text: What do you need?
I don't need any bows. I might be back for them. Take care.
Hand them over and I'll let you keep everything else.

dlgLine.text: The Coyotes? I heard they were taken out - didn't know that was you...
Please - I got a lot of good people here. What do you want to just leave us alone?

dlgAnsw.text: Give me half your food.
Leave peacefully and I'll spare your lives.
Ah, there it is. I just wanted to hear the fear in your voices.

dlgLine.text: Oh, I'll give you something alright... Fire!

dlgAnsw.text: <The members of the camp start shooting.>

dlgLine.text: Most of our food is hidden - someone will have to get it. You can keep a gun on me as insurance.
Pam - go get the tree stash... and hurry.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: There... Here's your food. Now... Just leave us be. We're no threat to your people.

dlgAnsw.text: You better not come looking for us. Anyone fires on me, I'll kill you all.
You did the right thing for your group. Good luck to you all.
You're right. And that's why I'll be taking all of it. <Attack him>

dlgLine.text: Yeah... we're doing okay. But I'd rather die than give someone the satisfaction of taking what's ours.

dlgAnsw.text: Honestly - we've got food, water, running electricity, plumbing... You'd be better off with us. There's safety in numbers.
Maybe we could trade info.
I'm a competent medic - if you've got any sick or injured, I could take a look.
There's got to be something here collecting dust. I've got a few things myself.
I can teach your people how to make simple explosives.
How many thumbs do you think I could cut off before someone brought it out to me?
I guess we'll leave you in peace, then. Good luck to you.

dlgLine.text: Wait a sec...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -
- New Answ -

dlgLine.text: My name is Ben.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Now, I don't know quite what to make of you yet, but I can't say it's been unpleasant to see another person surviving through all this.
If you find yourself out here again... why don't you stop by. It'd be nice to exchange information, or just chat, you know? Maybe we can be of use to each other in the future.

dlgAnsw.text: Are you sure you won't come with us?
I will, Ben. Be careful out here.

dlgLine.text: We'll discuss it, but don't get your hopes up. You have a safe journey back to your shelter.
You can walk around our camp, if you want - but stay out of our people's cabins. They get a little jumpy around strangers and they're likely to start shooting if they think you're robbing them.

dlgAnsw.text: <Ben nods to the others and let's them know you're not a threat.>

dlgLine.text: We'll be alright. You have a safe journey back to your shelter.
You can walk around our camp, if you want - but stay out of our people's cabins. They get a little jumpy around strangers and they're likely to start shooting if they think you're robbing them.

dlgAnsw.text: <Ben nods to the others and let's them know you're not a threat.>

dlgLine.text: Why do you think we're so on edge? Others have come through here...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Couple of bikers, tried to take some of the women and the food while we were out fishing. First people to ever find us. Shooting those men was kind of a wake-up call about just how fucked up everything's become.

dlgAnsw.text: You're welcome to come with us - we have a shelter - running water, electricty, fence - it's safe.
Those guys are the Coyotes. If you had let them live, they would have come back and killed all of you.
Those were Coyotes. I took care of them - they won't be back.
You heard anything about what's going on outside this area? Good news, I hope?
You have anything you might be looking to trade?

dlgLine.text: Jacob, Pam - everyone, open fire!

dlgAnsw.text: <Combat begins.>

dlgLine.text: I figured. Wasn't really any other option.

dlgAnsw.text: You heard anything about what's going on outside this area? Good news, I hope?
You have anything you might be looking to trade?
Since you're using the supplies here, I guess we'll get going.

dlgLine.text: That's a relief. We kept expecting another group to hit us any day now. Good to know they're not coming back.

dlgAnsw.text: You have anything you might be looking to trade?
You heard anything about what's going on outside this area? Good news, I hope?
Since you're using the supplies here, I guess we'll get going.

dlgLine.text: We've got all we need right here. Thanks for the offer, but we're staying here.

dlgAnsw.text: You heard anything about what's going on outside this area? Good news, I hope?
You have anything you might be looking to trade?
Since you're using the supplies here, I guess we'll get going.

dlgLine.text: If you want to trade, I need something useful - something that will benefit all of us.

dlgAnsw.text: Honestly - we've got food, water, running electricity, plumbing... You'd be better off with us. There's safety in numbers.
Maybe we could trade info - have you heard anything about what's going on outside this area?
I'm a competent medic - if you've got any sick or injured, I could take a look.
There's got to be something here collecting dust. I've got a few things myself.
I can teach your people how to make simple explosives.
You're all set, huh? Must mean you've stockpiled quite a bounty...
I guess we'll leave you in peace, then. Good luck to you.

dlgLine.text: We heard that too, on the radio.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: So much for getting an all-clear in the future. Guess we'll have to be extra cautious about protecting our borders.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Seriously? I may just have to send some people to check it out. Thanks.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Here - why don't you take these bows. We got plenty of them. I can't give you any arrows, but I'm sure you can find or make some.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks. Good luck to all of you.
Well, I wish you would all join me, but I understand if you can't. I'll be on my way.
That's it? I can't eat bows - what else you got?

dlgLine.text: I don't know much - we don't really take any unnecessary risks. One guy here says he heard the military was on their way to our neck of the woods - like they were sweeping out areas of those corpses, you know. I won't believe it until I see it, though.

dlgAnsw.text: You have anything you might be looking to get rid of?
Since you're using the supplies here, I guess we'll get going.

dlgLine.text: You again - your 'information' got two of my guys killed! Those cities were crawling with the dead. Now, I'm not going to kill you outright, but if you don't turn around this instant, I'll make you wish I had.

dlgAnsw.text: So, what you're saying is... your numbers are fewer? Excellent, now we'll finish you off.
What? They're all clear now - I swear. Send more guys.
Sorry. I thought I was telling you what you wanted to hear. I'll go peacefully.

dlgLine.text: You son of a bitch!
You bitch!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Oh, it's you again. Good to see you're still alive and kicking. Thanks for coming back to see us.

dlgAnsw.text: How are you holding up, Ben?
Sara and Mia told me to talk to you about letting them come with us.
Heard anything new?
You have anything you want to trade?
You interested in joining us yet? We could use your help.

dlgLine.text: Been seeing more dead folk around here lately. Guess more of them are making it here from the cities. Nothing we can't handle, but no matter how many times I see them, they always give me the willies something fierce.

dlgAnsw.text: Heard anything new?
You have anything you want to trade?
You interested in joining us yet? We could use your help.
Just checking up on you - I should get going. Be safe.
I should get going. Be safe.

dlgLine.text: Not really. Seems like the radio has gone dead for good.
Yeah... <sigh>

dlgAnsw.text: How are you holding up, Ben?
You have anything you want to trade?
You interested in joining us yet? We could use your help.
Just checking up on you - I should get going. Be safe.
I should get going. Be safe.

dlgLine.text: I have something for you... Wait here.

dlgAnsw.text: <Wait>
<Shoot him when he turns his back>

dlgLine.text: One of our cats gave birth to a litter of kittens. Just seeing that new life... it gave us hope, you know. I call this one Smoky, on account of him nearly tumbling into the fire. I want you to have him.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks! What a cutie. I'll take good care of him!
Not much meat on him, but he'll do.

dlgLine.text: So long, Smoky. You be good.

dlgAnsw.text: How are you holding up, Ben?
You interested in joining us yet? We could use your help.
Just checking up on you - I should get going. Be safe.

dlgLine.text: You're not really going to eat this cat, right?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm just kidding.
Yeaaa- no. Um... never.

dlgLine.text: Okay then...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I brought it up... There's a few people who are open to it. I don't know, maybe we would be better off, but the whole group has to be in agreement. Maybe they'll come around - hit us up in a week or two.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll do that.
You want me to talk to them? Maybe if they trusted me.

dlgLine.text: Gotta understand, everyone's real on edge. The corpses keep showing up. Some of us have been thinking this place might not be the fortress we thought it was, but changing some people's minds... it's difficult.

dlgAnsw.text: How are you holding up, Ben?
Just checking up on you - I should get going. Be safe.
I should get going. Be safe.

dlgLine.text: They won't listen.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Stay alive, okay? And come back and see us. I enjoy these visits... makes me feel like we're not so alone in the world.

dlgAnsw.text: Good to see you too. Good luck to you and everyone else.
I wish you'd just come with us... but I understand. See ya.

dlgLine.text: You got what you want... Now just leave us be. We don't want anymore trouble.

dlgAnsw.text: You were in trouble the minute I found this place. <Attack him>
I'm afraid I need to borrow your stuff. Permanently.
You may live another day for now. Enjoy it.

dlgLine.text: That's all we're not using. Camp used to teach archery, so the shed was full of them. Otherwise, supplies are tight for us.

dlgAnsw.text: I understand. At least you're keeping this place together. That's something.
No way - my people need to eat. I need something more than bows.
That's too bad. Guess I'll be going.

dlgLine.text: Something else you need?

dlgAnsw.text: Sara and Mia told me to talk to you about letting them come with us.
You have anything you might be looking to trade?
Not right now, no. See ya around.

dlgLine.text: Oh, they did, did they?
Truth is... I'd let you take Mia out of here no problem. But Sara's the closest thing we have to a medic, and we can't really function without one.
But as to how much longer we can tolerate Mia - I don't know... it's a tough call.

dlgAnsw.text: What's wrong with Mia?
Let me take them off your hands. Mia will be my problem.
What do you want for them?
Sara needs a lab. And if she discovers a treatment for bites, I'll share it with you.
They practically begged me to take them out of here.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, okay. I'll be sad to see Sara go, but... to be honest, neither of them really fit in here.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks, Ben. I'll tell Sara you said it was okay.
I'll go tell Sara. I'll keep them safe - you have my word.

dlgLine.text: That's fair. And honestly, it'd be a better use of her training than putting stiches in people.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks, Ben. I'll tell Sara you said it was okay.
I'll go tell Sara. I'll keep them safe - you have my word.

dlgLine.text: Uh... they're not my property. Man... look... if they want to go with you, that's their call. But for right now, I think I'd rather they stayed here. Sorry.

dlgAnsw.text: Fine. Maybe I should ask them again.
Forget I asked.

dlgLine.text: That doesn't really sound like Sara... You know what, I think I'd rather they stayed here for now. Sorry.

dlgAnsw.text: Fine. Maybe I should ask them again.
Forget I asked.

dlgLine.text: You know, ever since they've been here, they've mostly kept to themselves. Yeah, sure they pitch in when I ask - well, Sara does, mostly, but Mia... Something's up with that girl.

Honestly, I can't count on Mia and she's a drag on the camp. And Sara's stiched some wounds, but she's no medic and all she ever thinks about is getting back to her research. I tell you what... if you think you can offer them a better situation, they're yours.

dlgAnsw.text: I appreciate it.
You know... if they're not that useful, I can't use them.

dlgLine.text: Well, I was kind of hoping you'd say that. It'd be hard to lose them - I mean, it's hard to lose anyone these days.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks for your honestly. See ya, Ben.
If you ever need to dump them on someone, send them my way.
